name: market for cement, Portland | cement, Portland | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21560/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;The dataset describes the maket for Portland cement in Peru. The dataset includes the cement transport of 246 km (average of 8 plants) to the concrete mixing plant (ready-mix concrete) and the store (self construction). No transporation losses are assumed. 

From cement plant gate.

This market dataset ends with the delivery of the cement to the concrete mixing site. The dataset includes the transport.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The production volume and current working plants of 2016 is considered.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents the current distances for cement production in Peru

flow.name: cement, Portland
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

exchanges.description:
Literature value. The weighted average of 8 plants. Pacasmayo reports in (Pacasmayo, 2017b) the distance from the 3 plants to the principal markets. UNACEM dispatches most of the production to Lima. For Yura, it was assumed that most of the production is dispatched to Yura to Cuzco, Tacna, Arequipa and La Paz (exports to Bolivia) (Yura, 2017a). 

Pacasmayo, 20.7% market share. 3 plants, 560km distance: Average distance from the cement plants to the principal markets (North Lima, Pacasmayo, Panamericana highway).

UNACEM and Cemento Caliza, 50.7% market share.  3 plants, 101km distance. Average distance from the cement plants of Atocongo and Condorcocha to the District of Lima which represent major part of UNACEM’s market. Cemento Caliza considered similar distance as UNACEM.

Yura cement, 24.3% market share. 2 plants, 327km distance.  Average distance from the cement plants to the principal markets (Cuzco, Tacna, Arequipa, La Paz)
